more details please, what is the difference from dump manager in phosphor debug collector? what this is handling and why we need this code here?
Done
it does implement com.ibm.dump.server.create interface too
Done
delete? we will not copy manager objects I guess
Done
this is never used
Done

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/cpp/header-files-cpp?view=msvc-170#what-to-put-in-a-header-file

as per guidelines using directive in header files should be avoided, which I kind of agree 

this is the code change here.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-certificate-manager/+/50010/4

using and typealias will pollute the code when that corresponding header file is included.
Done

patrick in one of the review was saying these things will never change so why put it in configs rather add it to header file, which I kind of agree.

suggestion
we are following this but we can reconsider later
Ack
A few comments/observations
Use of directives in header files is not so much preferred I believe due to namespace pollution. We can rather use those in cpp files itself for ease of coding.
This is for setting these interfaces as the parent for manager
Can the I/P params be made constant? Also instead of const char* can we have const std::string& (less scary than pointer looks, also more of C++ type)?
Done
The parent is accepting like this so keeping it like this
const DumpCreateParams& ?
Done
As we are taking references here so if these members aren't going to be changed later on then it is better to make them as const ones
Done
bus cant be cont due to bus.new_method_call
return event.loop(); and delete line no 18

we can use sdeventplus_dep
